com.avaya.csta.e164

Interface E164ConversionServices


  • public interface E164ConversionServices
    Used to convert between E.164 numbers and switch dial strings (extensions, for example). E164ConversionServices is an Avaya extension to the CSTA Specification.

    Prerequisites Before using E164Services do the following:

    1. Get access to E164ConversionServices through the ServiceProvider. For example: 
       E164ConversionServices e164Svcs =
   (E164ConversionServices)servProv.getService(com.avaya.csta.e164.E164ConversionServices.class.getName());
    Version:
    $Revision: 1.5 $
    Author:
    AVAYA, Inc.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      ConvertDialStringToE164Response convertDialStringToE164(ConvertDialStringToE164 request)
      Converts a list of dial strings (extensions, for example) to E.164 numbers, using the administered conversion rules for the given switch.
      ConvertE164ToDialStringResponse convertE164ToDialString(ConvertE164ToDialString request)
      Converts a list of E.164 numbers to dial strings (extensions, for example), using the administered conversion rules for the given switch.

    • Method Detail

      • convertE164ToDialString

        ConvertE164ToDialStringResponse convertE164ToDialString(ConvertE164ToDialString request)
                                                 throws CstaException
        Converts a list of E.164 numbers to dial strings (extensions, for example), using the administered conversion rules for the given switch. These rules are administered using the Application Enablement Services OAM web pages.

        The E.164 numbers must be valid E.164 numbers, starting with a "+". (e.g. "+13035381234"). The dial strings are returned in the ConvertE164ToDialStringResponse.

        Note that if an E.164 number is successfully converted to a dial string, that is NOT an indication that the given E.164 has a corresponding extension on that switch. Properly configured dial plan rules will yield a diallable string for off-switch numbers as well, potentially including ARS, inter-region and international dial codes. In order to determine whether the resulting dial string represents an extension for that switch, your application must perform an action such as adding a CallControlListener or attempting to register that extension on the switch using RegistrationServices.

        Your code to convert E.164 numbers to dial strings may look like this: 

         E164List e164List = new E164List();
 String[] e164Array = {"+13035381212", "+13035381234", "+17205554321"};
 e164List.setE164Number(e164Array); 
 ConvertE164ToDialString request = new ConvertE164ToDialString();
 request.setSwitchName("mySwitch");
 request.setE164List(e164List);
 
 ConvertE164ToDialStringResponse response = e164Svcs.convertE164ToDialString(request);
 
 System.out.println("Switch was " + response.getSwitchName();
 E164ConversionResult []results = response.getResultList().getResult();
 for (E164ConversionResult result: results) {
     if (result.getResultType().equals(
             E164ConversionResultType.CONVERTED)) {
         System.out.println(result.getE164() +
             " mapped to " + result.getDialString());
     } else if (result.getResultType().equals(
             E164ConversionResultType.NO_MATCH)) {
         System.out.println("There wasn't a match for "
             + result.getE164());
     } else if (result.getResultType().equals(
             E164ConversionResultType.INVALID_INPUT)) {
         System.out.println(result.getE164() +
             " was not a valid input string");
     }
 }
        Parameters:
        request - A ConvertE164ToDialString service request that specifies the switch name and list of E.164 numbers to be converted.
        Returns:
        ConvertE164ToDialStringResponse The list of converted dial strings. May contain null dial strings if no conversion rule was found or if there was an invalid format (e.g. "13035380112" without a "+").
        Throws:
        InvalidParameterValueException - Thrown if the switch name does not match an administered switch name on the OAM pages.
        CstaException

      • convertDialStringToE164

        ConvertDialStringToE164Response convertDialStringToE164(ConvertDialStringToE164 request)
                                                 throws CstaException
        Converts a list of dial strings (extensions, for example) to E.164 numbers, using the administered conversion rules for the given switch.

        The E.164 numbers are returned in the ConvertDialStringToE164Response.

        Your code to convert dial strings to E.164 numbers may look like this: 

         DialStringList dialStringList = new DialStringList();
 String[] dialStringArray = {"5381212", "5381234", "7205554321"};
 dialStringList.setDialString(dialStringArray);
 ConvertDialStringToE164 request = new ConvertDialStringToE164();
 request.setSwitchName("mySwitch");
 request.setDialStringList(dialStringList);
 
 ConvertDialStringToE164Response response = e164Svcs.convertDialStringToE164(request);
 
 System.out.println("Switch was " + response.getSwitchName();
 E164ConversionResult []results = response.getResultList().getResult();
 for (E164ConversionResult result: results) {
     if (result.getResultType().equals(
             E164ConversionResultType.CONVERTED)) {
         System.out.println(result.getDialString() +
             " mapped to " + result.getE164());
     } else if (result.getResultType().equals(
             E164ConversionResultType.NO_MATCH)) {
         System.out.println("There wasn't a match for "
             + result.getDialString());
     } else if (result.getResultType().equals(
             E164ConversionResultType.INVALID_INPUT)) {
         System.out.println(result.getDialString() +
             " was not a valid input string.");
     }
 }
        Parameters:
        request - A ConvertDialStringToE164 service request that specifies the switch name and list of dial strings to be converted.
        Returns:
        ConvertDialStringToE164Response The list of converted E.164 numbers. May contain null entries if no conversion rule was found.
        Throws:
        InvalidParameterValueException - Thrown if the switch name does not match an administered switch name on the OAM pages.
        CstaException
